::DarkMouse::

Her curoisity was getting the better of her.  She walked over to 
Megatron and watched him on the computer.  She saw what he was going 
and watched and learned as he got into the computer files.
"Megatron, what will happen when the aliens arrive.  I have never 
delt with them before.  What can we do to protect ourselves against 
them.?"



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, JP3884@a... wrote:
>     Megatron looks to the monitor and reads all the data from the 
Aliens as 
> Aracnia and Tarantulas hover over him. He turns around and looks 
rather 
> displeaesed.
>     "This vessle is really quite dangerous....I admit. Its 
automated, probly 
> by an Artificial Intelligence Program. The only way to defeat it, 
would to be 
> to transmit a virus into the protocol program of the A.I., and that 
is 
> impossible." He said smugly, as if he were going to leave them all 
to die.
>     Aracnia shook her head, "So there nothing we can do?" Her voice 
was 
> filled with hopelessness.
>     "Well...further investigation of the Aliens might prove useful 
to there 
> demise. If you allow me, I would like access to all of the 
computers files." 
> He said turning back around to the computer.
>     Tarantulas shrugged his shoulders, and Aracnia looked to 
Darkmouse and 
> Quickstrike. This was a hard call but she had to do it. "Alright, 
you have my 
> premission. But dont try anything....we outnumber you and your 
fraction."
>     Megatron narrowed his eyes and gave a chuckle as he went deeper 
into the 
> computer files.
> 
>     The Armada sailed across the vast darkness of the empty abyss 
that was 
> deep space. It had begun the journey from its home port to the 
distant, and 
> rather unintelligent planet earth where the latest outpost had been 
placed. 
> And now was destroyed.
>     The ship, measureing exactly one kilomiter in length and half a 
kilomiter 
> around was a large, powerful ship with enugh firepower to turn a 
small moon 
> into ruble, let alone destroy a measly group of transformers who 
dar to 
> destroy one of the outposts.
>     Inside the ship were a series of endless computers and data 
tables. No 
> corridors, no rooms, nothing but data tables that held memory and 
everything 
> that ran the ship. The program, The Artificial Intelligence 
program, ran the 
> ship. It thrived in the main computer core and controled everything 
on the 
> ship, which actually was its body.
>     The A.I. was know as Apollo in the universal language that 
filled space. 
> It researched the beings know as Maximals and Predacons, knowing 
that 
> Maximals were on the 'good' side and the Predacons were on 
the 'bad' side. 
> But that didnt matter. The ones on this planet would be destroyed 
and if they 
> proved o be as weak and stupid as they seemed, Apollo would set a 
course for 
> Cybertron and destroy that as well. No need to have any competition 
for 
> Galactic domination.
>     The vessle continued its course. In a few hours it would reach 
earth. For 
> now Applo enjoyed the view as pluto slowly came into sight.
